intro: Amberboa somalensis, commonly known as the Somali amberboa, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Somalia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are typically arranged in a dense cluster, giving it a distinctive appearance. It is adapted to thrive in dry, sandy soils and is often found in coastal and semi-arid environments. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
